googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined:
* You may also vote early in-person, instead of voting by mail.  You may go to your county clerk’s office beginning the 28th day before the election and vote.  (Section 1-6-5, NMSA 1978).

* Expanded early voting is available in many counties beginning on the third Saturday before the election.

* Look up early voting locations here or call your county clerk for locations and dates and hours of operation.
Early voting ends the Saturday before the election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered New Mexico voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a New Mexico driver's license or state ID card.  If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your New Mexico driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in New Mexico you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of the State of New Mexico
  * be 18 years of age at the time of the next election
  * not have been denied the right to vote by a court of law by reason of mental incapacity
  * if you have been convicted of a felony, have completed all the terms and conditions of sentencing, have been granted a pardon by the Governor, or have had your conviction overturned on appeal
